intro: Mirbelia daviesioides var. rigida, commonly known as the rigid mirbelia, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is notable for its rigid, woody stems and its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
